item.title: Observer
item.description: This is a basic example of the Observer design pattern in Haxe. The pattern makes use of an Observer interface and an Observable base class to notify objects when another object's property is changed so that they can react accordingly.

item.title: Using Iterators as Generic Type Parameters
item.description: Iterators are a helpful Haxe structure. Any structure that implements the next and hasNext functions with the appropriate signature will allow you build a for loop. Arrays have an iterator() function that returns exactly this, and you don't need to call it, the for language construction does it for you.

item.title: Include a file next to a Haxe module file
item.description: This example lets you take a file next to the current module .hx file and include its file content. That can be very useful if you want to separate (for example) view templates, shader sources or other multiline texts from the Haxe source. The articles demonstrates how to do it with an expression macro but also with a build macro.
